p: The chemical profile (qualitative and quantitative composition) of the EO from C. nardus, as determined by GC-MS, is shown in Table 2. The following oxygen-containing monoterpenes (89.93%) were the major constituents: citronellal (27.34%), geraniol (23.21%), geranial (13.37%), citronellol (12.49%), and neral (10.31%). These monoterpenes are biosynthetically related and are derived from geranyl diphosphate. 32
